Additional Notes: Dr. Johannowsky has kindly informed me that the fragments, referred to by Marcello Gigante in PdP, 1984, p. 151, and originally said to come from a calyxNon Sepcifiedkrater are in fact from a squat lekythos [StEtr 52, 1984, p. 497). The signature AZ... Al ErPACPEN is inscribed on the base of a column or stele. To left is a male figure in a himation, to right two women, one making a libation from an oenochoe; another fragment depicts part of a satyr, but its location cannot be determined. No further details are at present available.
